detaileddescription.para: Wrappers to convert INTERPRET_AS_X macros to INTERPRET_AS_PARENT macros.

memberdef.name: MAKE_PRIMARY_MODEL_FUNCTOR_MAIN
memberdef.initializer: /* Create the function wrapper object (functor) */ \ namespace Functown \ { \ primary_model_functor FUNCTION \ (&ORIGIN::FUNCTION, STRINGIFY(FUNCTION), STRINGIFY(CAPABILITY), \ "ModelParameters", STRINGIFY(ORIGIN), ModelDB()); \ } \

briefdescription.para: Main version of MAKE_FUNCTOR modified to build primary_parameters functors.

detaileddescription.para: Macros to create and register primary model functors.
We need this extra wrapper in order to define these special functors and add them to the Core's primary model functor list (no other functors allowed here).

memberdef.name: MAKE_PRIMARY_MODEL_FUNCTOR_SUPP
memberdef.initializer: /* Register the functor with the Core. */ \ int CAT(coreg_,FUNCTION) = register_model_functor_core(Functown::FUNCTION); \

briefdescription.para: Supplementary version of MAKE_FUNCTOR modded for primary_parameters functors.

memberdef.name: DECLARE_BACKEND_REQ
memberdef.initializer: MODULE_BACKEND_REQ(MODEL, FUNCTION, GROUP, REQUIREMENT, TAGS, TYPE, ARGS, IS_VARIABLE, IS_MODEL)

memberdef.name: LONG_DECLARE_BACKEND_REQ
memberdef.initializer: MODULE_BACKEND_REQ(MODULE, FUNCTION, GROUP, REQUIREMENT, TAGS, TYPE, ARGS, IS_VARIABLE, IS_MODEL)

memberdef.name: MODULE_INTERPRET_AS_X_FUNCTION

briefdescription.para: "In module" version of the INTERPRET_AS_X_FUNCTION macro

detaileddescription.para: "Rollcall" macros. These are lifted straight from module_macros_incore.hpp but are modified here and there to suit the role of models.

briefdescription.para: "In module" version of the INTERPRET_AS_X_DEPENDENCY macro

detaileddescription.para: Piggybacks off the CORE_START_MODULE_COMMON macro, as we need all the same machinery.

Tells the core that the current parameter corresponds to the specified CAPABILITY, so that module functions can then draw upon them like any other capabilities. Draws from CORE_START_CAPABILITY macro. So far we only allow parameters of type double (currently the parameter object cannot store anything else anyway). If we really want to allow integer or maybe complex parameters later we could extend some things in here.

memberdef.name: DEFINEPAR

detaileddescription.para: Macro to define parameter. Does not create a corresponding CAPABILITY; use MAP_TO_CAPABILITY to do this after calling DEFINEPAR(S).

briefdescription.para: Real declaration macro for INTERPRET_AS_X functions.
Generic declaration macro for INTERPRET_AS_ functions.
Add a dependency to an interpret-as-X function.
Macro to get to model namespace easily.

detaileddescription.para: Macro to easily get the Pipes for an INTERPRET_AS_X function, for retrieving dependencies
